This command gets the properties of the media service named mediaservice1 in the resource group named resourcegroup1.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command get the key information for accessing the media service named mediaservice1 in the resource group named resourcegroup1.

maml:description.maml:para: Checks whether a Media Service name is available. Media Service names are globally unique.
The name of the Media Service.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Checks whether a Media Service name is available. --------------------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command checks if the name mediaservice1 is available.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a media service. If the media service already exists, all its properties are updated with the input provided.
The name of the Resource Group of the Media Service.
The name of the Resource Group of the Media Service.
The region to create the media service in.
The storage account associated with the media service account.
Tags for the media service.
The name of the Resource Group of the Media Service.
The name of the Resource Group of the Media Service.
The region to create the media service in.
An array of storage accounts to associate with the media service.
Tags for the media service.
The name of the Resource Group of the Media Service.
The name of the Resource Group of the Media Service.
The region to create the media service in.
The storage account associated with the media service account.
Tags for the media service.
An array of storage accounts to associate with the media service.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example1: Create a media service with the primary storage account only --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\># Variables ## Global $ResourceGroupName = "resourcegroup1" $Location = "East US"
## Storage $StorageName = "storage1" $StorageType = "Standard_GRS"
## Media Service $Tags = @{"tag1" = "value1"; "tag2" = "value2"} $MediaServiceName = "mediaservice1"
# Resource Group New-AzureRmResourceGroup -Name $ResourceGroupName -Location $Location
# Storage $StorageAccount = New-AzureRmStorageAccount -ResourceGroupName $ResourceGroupName -Name $StorageName -Location $Location -Type $StorageType
# Media Service New-AzureRmMediaService -ResourceGroupName $ResourceGroupName -AccountName $MediaServiceName -Location $Location -StorageAccountId $StorageAccount.Id -Tags $Tags

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example shows how to create a media service with specifying primary storage account only. This script uses several other cmdlets.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2: Create a media service with multiple storage accounts --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\># Variables
## Global $ResourceGroupName = "resourcegroup1" $Location = "East US"
## Storage $StorageName1 = "storage1" $StorageName2 = "storage2" $StorageType = "Standard_GRS"
## Media Service $Tags = @{"tag1" = "value1"; "tag2" = "value2"} $MediaServiceName = "mediaservice1"
# Resource Group New-AzureRmResourceGroup -Name $ResourceGroupName -Location $Location
# Storage $StorageAccount1 = New-AzureRmStorageAccount -ResourceGroupName $ResourceGroupName -Name $StorageName1 -Location $Location -Type $StorageType $StorageAccount2 = New-AzureRmStorageAccount -ResourceGroupName $ResourceGroupName -Name $StorageName2 -Location $Location -Type $StorageType
# Media Service
## Setup the storage configuration object. $PrimaryStorageAccount = New-AzureRmMediaServiceStorageConfig -StorageAccountId $StorageAccount1.Id -IsPrimary $SecondaryStorageAccount = New-AzureRmMediaServiceStorageConfig -StorageAccountId $StorageAccount2.Id $StorageAccounts = @($PrimaryStorageAccount, $SecondaryStorageAccount)
## Create a media service. New-AzureRmMediaService -ResourceGroupName $ResourceGroupName -AccountName $MediaServiceName -Location $Location -StorageAccounts $StorageAccounts -Tags $Tags

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command shows how to create a media service with multiple storage accounts. This script uses several other cmdlets.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command updates the media service named mediaservice1 in the resource group named resourcegroup1 with tags object stored in $Tags variable and an array of storage configuration objects stored in $StorageAccounts variable. For how to build an array of storage configuration objects, please see the Example 2 of New-AzureRmMediaService cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Synchronizes storage account keys for a storage account associated with the Media Service.
The name of the Resource Group of the Media Service.
The name of the Media Service.
The storage account associated with the media service account.
The name of the Resource Group of the Media Service.
The name of the Media Service.
The storage account associated with the media service account.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Synchronizes storage account keys for a storage account associated with the Media Service. --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\># Variables $ResoureceGroupName = "resourcegroup1"
# Gets a storage account associated with the media service. $StorageAccount = Get-AzureRmStorageAccount -ResourceGroupName $ResourceGroupName -Name "storage1"
# Synchronizes the storage account keys. Sync-AzureRmMediaServiceStorageKeys -ResourceGroupName $ResourceGroupName -AccoutName "mediaservice1" -StorageAccoutId $StorageAccount.Id

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command synchronizes the keys of storage account named storage1 associated with the media service named mediaservice1 in the resource group resourcegroup1.

maml:description.maml:para: Create a storage account configuration for the media service cmdlets.
The storage account id.
Specifies the storage account as the primary storage for the media service.
The storage account id.
Specifies the storage account as the primary storage for the media service.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Create a storage account configuration for the media service Cmdlets. --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\># Create a storage account. $StorageAccount = New-AzureRmStorageAccount -ResourceGroupName $ResourceGroupName -Name "storage1" -Location "East US" -Type "Standard_GRS"
# Create a storage configuration object as the primary storage account associated with the media service. New-AzureRmMediaServiceStorageConfig -StorageAccountId $StorageAccount.Id -IsPrimary

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a storage configuration object by using storage account named storage1 and specifying it as the primary.
